text:
Hey folks! Sorry for the long post.

I was wondering if any of you might have some input on job titles and / or avenues to do salary research for a role that I've been offered. The title originally suggested was *Retention Marketing Manager*, then *Manager of Owned Media*. I think the role may be in line with a *Content Marketing Manager*, though.

I have been working in a content marketing / content creation role, writing/optimizing/editing blog posts and doing SEO work, but my expertise spans across ecommerce marketing (I held a Digital Media Director role before this) and my strengths lie in strategy and content direction. Recently, my manager offered me a new, higher role as the company is restructuring its brand teams. This role would oversee all of our owned media channels including social, email, and the blog. I would be responsible for forming and implementing growth strategies as well as managing other content associates, customer service associates, and community managers. My manager offered me to choose my own title and I also need a title to do salary research as I believe their initial offer is too low (likely because the researched "Retention Manager" which is basically a customer service manager).

In the rapidly evolving world of ecommerce and digital marketing in general, there seems to be no consistency on titles. So how do you determine which title will accurately describe your role _and_ benefit you in your career path? Any sites or avenues to research this? TIA!

text:
First of all, congrats!! This is so exciting. Secondly, seems like you're really taking full ownership of content, community, and customer service. IMO this goes beyond just Content Marketing Manager. I'd argue for Head of Content & Community, which firmly puts content and social under your belt. The customer service aspect is interesting but I'm not sure how to incorporate that into the title. Another option is Head of Content & Customer Success. 

Some things to consider for title hierarchy: 

• How many people will report into you? 
• How much time will you spend on execution vs strategy? 
• Will you be in charge of hiring and growing the team in the near future? 
• What will your day-to-day look like?

The customer service aspect is interesting but I'm not sure how to incorporate that into the title. Another option is Head of Content & Customer Success. 

Some things to consider for title hierarchy:
How many people will report into you?
How much time will you spend on execution vs strategy?
Will you be in charge of hiring and growing the team in the near future?
What will your day-to-day look like?
